alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 9:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, northern Scott and southern Clinton Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 926 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Calamus, or 13 miles northeast of Durant, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grand Mound and Donahue around 935 AM CDT. DeWitt and Long Grove around 945 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include McCausland, Camanche, Princeton, Cordova and Low Moor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
